Posts.Content: Crystaljuju Hi Jonathan15  That's quite an obvious swelling. I'm guessing it wasn't there when you went to the consultant?  How long ago did you get seen? Such an obvious swelling is more than likely to be a cyst or to do with sweat glands.  You really do need to get that checked out but not because I think it's cancer but obviously something is wrong. All the best Julia  Thanks for fast reply , this forum is really best , swelling is obvious but can it be due to my shoulder joint swelling or something like that because I do physical examination of my self every month since  I started developing little gynecomastia , so I check my rbeast for lump etc , I think it is possible that I may have pressed too much on my underarm which have caused swelling , Evaluate the pic that you find swelling in right armpit , or it is same like left armpit?
Posts.Title: Lump under my armpit

Posts.Content: mistymoley Hi Jonathan15  I agree with Julia, you obviously do have a lump and the only way to establish what it might be, is via a biopsy or scan.  Get back to your consultant and ask for the lump to be checked properly.  We aren't able to give medical advice, because we are not medically trained, but you can call the nurses on the helpline 0808 808 0000. they will be open at 9am on Monday until 8pm, and every weekday.   Good luck and do let us know how you get on. Thanks , I will get that checked soon , but lump is more hard and fixed I think , and this stuff is on my skin with more like muscles in it and is very soft although my whole skin is soft like old guy so I doubt it , still in worries , can u tell what u judged from the photo I sent?
